msIdentifier.institution: Royal Asiatic Society of Great Britain and Ireland

msItem.title: A selection from the Diwan of Nasir 'Ali.
Dīvān
ديوان
msItem.note: According to the colophon, the selection was made by the poet himself. Final folio, verso: note giving the number of folios at completion as 84, probably by the original scribe. Front flyleaf, verso: a number of ruba'is. Inside back cover: pasted slip, the name printed: Presented by George Thomas Staunton Feby 7. 1824. Ruled margins and dividing panels in red. Headings etc in red. According to the colophon, the selection was made by the poet himself. Scribe is described as resident of the chaklah ... , parganah ... Badayun, Subah Shahjahanabad.
msItem.incipit: Mahabbat jadah-i darad nihan dar khalwat-i dil-ha

layoutDesc.p: 15 lines to the page in double column

handNote.persName: Ghulam Ahmad son of Dust Muhammad Shaikhzadah

bindingDesc.p: Brown leather Indian binding with stamped decoration.

origin.p: Shikar? Shahabad in Qanauj? Noon on Monday 25 Ramadan A.H. 1194 (25 September 1780).

availability.p: Visitors are welcome to consult manuscripts in the library by prior appointment. Information on access is available on the library page of the Society's web site at www.royalasiaticsociety.org and appointments can be arranged by e-mailing library@royalasiaticsociety.org
